message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper discusses learning options, which is a subfield of reinforcement learning (RL) and machine learning (ML). The paper also mentions practical gradient-based learning algorithms, which suggests a focus on optimization and implementation. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.RO (Robotics). The paper also mentions the Arcade Learning Environment (ALE), which suggests a focus on computer vision and image processing, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a likely sub-category as well. Finally, the paper discusses bounded rationality, which suggests a focus on decision-making and control, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category.
